marginaleffects 0.0.0.9000
  • Functions
  • Changelog

Generate "counterfactual" datasets for use in marginaleffects's newdata argument

Source: R/counterfactual_typical.R
counterfactual.Rd

Generate "counterfactual" datasets for use in marginaleffects's newdata argument

counterfactual(..., model = NULL, data = NULL)

Arguments

...

named arguments with vectors of values for the variables to construct (see Examples below.)
model

Model object
data

data.frame (one and only one of the model and data arguments must be true).

Value

A data.frame where each row of the original data is repeated multiple times for each of the values of the variables in the at list. See example below.

If users supply a model, the data used to fit that model is retrieved using the insight::get_data function, and then replicated with different values of the variables in the at list.

Examples

# All rows are repeated twice, with different values of `hp`
cd <- counterfactual(data = mtcars, hp = c(100, 110))
cd[cd$rowid %in% 1:3,]

#>    rowid  mpg cyl disp drat    wt  qsec vs am gear carb  hp
#> 1      1 21.0   6  160 3.90 2.620 16.46  0  1    4    4 100
#> 2      2 21.0   6  160 3.90 2.875 17.02  0  1    4    4 100
#> 3      3 22.8   4  108 3.85 2.320 18.61  1  1    4    1 100
#> 33     1 21.0   6  160 3.90 2.620 16.46  0  1    4    4 110
#> 34     2 21.0   6  160 3.90 2.875 17.02  0  1    4    4 110
#> 35     3 22.8   4  108 3.85 2.320 18.61  1  1    4    1 110

# We get the same result by feeding a model instead of a data.frame
mod <- lm(mpg ~ hp + wt, mtcars)
cd <- counterfactual(model = mod, hp = c(100, 110))
cd[cd$rowid %in% 1:3,]

#>    rowid    wt  hp
#> 1      1 2.620 100
#> 2      2 2.875 100
#> 3      3 2.320 100
#> 33     1 2.620 110
#> 34     2 2.875 110
#> 35     3 2.320 110

# Use in `marginaleffects` to compute "Counterfactual Average Marginal Effects"
marginaleffects(mod, newdata = counterfactual(hp = c(100, 110)))

#>     rowid term        dydx   std.error    wt  hp
#> 1       1   hp -0.03177295 0.009029704 2.620 100
#> 2       1   wt -3.87783074 0.632733547 2.620 100
#> 3       2   hp -0.03177295 0.009029704 2.875 100
#> 4       2   wt -3.87783074 0.632733322 2.875 100
#> 5       3   hp -0.03177295 0.009029704 2.320 100
#> 6       3   wt -3.87783074 0.632733097 2.320 100
#> 7       4   wt -3.87783074 0.632733322 3.215 100
#> 8       4   hp -0.03177295 0.009029704 3.215 100
#> 9       5   hp -0.03177295 0.009029704 3.440 100
#> 10      5   wt -3.87783074 0.632733322 3.440 100
